name: Pech Lithlord
condition_immunities: exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

actions.desc: The pech lithlord makes three attacks: two with its pick and one with its hammer. If the pech lithlord hits the same target with two attacks, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.
actions.name: Pick

actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.
actions.name: Hammer

special_abilities.desc: While in bright light, the pech has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
special_abilities.name: Light Sensitivity

special_abilities.desc: As a bonus action, the pech can draw on the power of unworked stone, as long as it is in contact with stone. Until the end of the pech’s next turn, it gains resistance to piercing and slashing damage.
special_abilities.name: One with the Stone (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

special_abilities.desc:
The pech lithlord’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15). The pech lithlord can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: mending, thunderwave (4d8)
3/day: shatter (4d8)
1/day: meld into stone, stone shape
special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
